description.en: The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `caitra` month is known as `kAmadA-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `vaizAkha` month is known as `mOhinI-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `jyaiSTha` month is known as `nirjalA-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `ASADha` month is known as `zayana-EkAdazI`. Lord Vishnu goes to sleep for four months beginning today.

shlokas:
vAsudEva jagadyOnE prAptEyaM dvAdazI tava.
bhujaGgazayanE'bdhau ca sukhaM svapihi mAdhava..
iyaM tu dvAdazI dEva zayanArthaM vinirmita.
asyAM suptE jagannAthE jagatsuptaM bhavEdidam..
vibuddhE tvayi buddhyEta sarvamEtaccarAcaram..

description.en: The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `zravaNa` month is known as `pavitrOpAna-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `bhAdrapada` month is known as `parivartinI-EkAdazI`. Sideways turn inside sleep of Lord Vishnu midway after Shayana Ekadashi.

shlokas:
vAsudEva jagannAtha prAptEyaM dvAdazI tava.
pArzvEna parivartasva sukhaM svapihi mAdhava..

description.en: The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `Azvayuja` month is known as `pApAGkuzA-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `kArtika` month is known as `utthAna-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `mArgazIrSa` month is known as `mOkSadA-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `pauSa` month is known as `putradA-EkAdazI`.
The Jaya-paksha Ekadashi of `mAgha` month is known as `bhaimI-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `phAlguna` month is known as `AmalakI-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `adhika` month is known as `padminI-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `vRzcikamAsa` is known as `guruvAyupura-EkAdazI`.
The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `dhanurmAsa` is known as `vaikuNTha-EkAdazI`.

The Shukla-paksha Ekadashi of `vRzcikamAsa` is also celebrated as `kaizika-EkAdazI`. Kaisika Puranam, consisting of 82 shlokas describes the story of `ta:nampADuvAn2` and a `rAkSasa` who attained mukti by `nAmasaGkIrtanam` and the fruits of `ta:nampADuvAn`'s `nAmasaGkIrtanam`, respectively!
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `caitra` month is known as `varUthinI-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `vaizAkha` month is known as `aparA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `jyaiSTha` month is known as `yOginI-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `ASADha` month is known as `kAmikA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `zravaNa` month is known as `ajA-EkAdazI`. Satya Harishchandra performed this to get back family and kingdom.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `bhAdrapada` month is known as `indirA-EkAdazI`. Indrasena's son did Ekadashi and as a result he was shifted from hell to heaven.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `Azvayuja` month is known as `ramA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `kArtika` month is known as `utpannA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `mArgazIrSa` month is known as `saphalA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `pauSa` month is known as `SaTtilA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `mAgha` month is known as `vijayA-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `phAlguna` month is known as `pApamOcanI-EkAdazI`.
The Krishna-paksha Ekadashi of `adhika` month is known as `paramA-EkAdazI`.
Being the first day of the new year, read the `paJcAGga` today, followed by naivedyam of `pAnakam` to `gaNEzAdi trayastriMzat kOTi dEvatAH`.
Monthly Shashthi vratam for Lord Subrahmanya.
`tulArAziM gatE sUryE pUrvasmin bhRguvAsarE`

notes: Pravachanam of Brahmmasri Ky. Bharaneedhara Sastrigal, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rgXwyo0L3i8&feature=youtu.be&t=222

description.en: `upavAsam` with only water and next day `pAraNa` gives `ArOgyam`

shlokas:
ASADha zuklaSaSThI tu tithiH kaumArilA smRtA.
kumAramarcayEttatra pUrvatrOpESya vai dinam..

description.en: Skanda darshanam is recommended, removes sins including brahmahatya.

shlokas:
yO'syAM pazyati gAGgEyaM dakSiNApathavAsinam.
brahmahatyAdi pApaistu mucyatE nAtra saMzayaH..

description.en: One of the most important vratams, alongside Krishnajanmashtami, Shivaratri etc. Must observe fast. Offer Arghyam facing South, using Curd, Akshata, Water and Flowers (`dadhnAkSatOdakaiH puSpaiH`) chanting the shloka below.

shlokas:
asyAM hi zrIH samAyuktaH yasmAt skandO'bhavat purA.
tasmATSaSThyAM na bhuJjIta prApnuyAdbhArgavI sadA..

saptarSidAraja skanda sEnAdhipa mahAbala.
rudrOmAgnija SaDvaktra gaGgAgarbha namO'stu tE..

description.en: Also known as `campA/campaka SaSThI`

shlokas:
sEnAvidAraka skanda mahAsEna mahAbala.
rudrOmAgnija SaDvaktra gaGgAgarbha namO'stu tE..

description.en: `saptamI tithi` on a Sunday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Particularly good for worshipping Surya.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

description.en: A very special yOga, for doing Pitru Shraddha during Mahalaya Paksham. A man that performs a sraddha in the conjunction called Gajacchaya at a place that is fanned by the leaves of the Aswattha tree enjoys the fruits thereof, O Yudhishthira, for a hundred thousand kalpas.

shlokas:
chAyAyAM kariNaH zrAddhaM tatkarma parivIjitam.
dazakalpAyutAnIha na kSIyEta yudhiSThira..3-203-121..
mahAbhAratE vanaparvaNi trayOttaradvizatatamE'dhyAyE

description.en: `saptamI tithi` on a Sunday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Particularly good for worshipping Surya. Today is even more auspicious, as it is associated with `rEvatI` star.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

description.en: `aSTamI tithi` on a Wednesday is as sacred as a solar eclipse.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

description.en: `caturthI tithi` on a Tuesday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Good day for doing puja of Ganesha/Subrahmanya with naivedyam of modakam/millet flour respectively.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

description.en: `kRSNa caturdazI tithi` on a Tuesday is very sacred. Perform `tarpaNam` to Yama Dharamaraja.
`amAvasyA` on a Monday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Particularly good for performing pradakshinam of Pippala tree.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

mUlatO brahmarUpAya madhyatO viSNurUpiNE.
agrataH zivarUpAya vRkSarAjAya tE namaH..
akSispandaM bhujaspandaM duHsvapnaM durvicintanam.
zatrUnAm ca samutpannam azvattha zamayasva mE..

description.en: Have darshan of Moon today, chanting the following shloka

shlokas:
zvEtAmbaraH zvEtavibhUSaNazca zvEtadyutirdaNDadharO dvibAhuH.
candrO'mRtAtmA varadaH kirITI mayi prasAdaM vidadhAtu dEvaH..

description.en: On Chaitra Amavasya, who gives a pot filled with `pAnakam`, he has indeed performed a hundred `gayAzrAddham`! He also gets the benefit of performing `SaNNavatizrAddham`!

shlokas:
yO dadyAccaitradarzE tu kumbhaM pUrNaM tu pAnakaiH.
gayAzrAddhazataM tEna kRtamEva na saMzayaH..52..
kastUrI karpurOpEtaM mallikOzIrasaMyutam.
kalazaM pAnakaiH pUrNaM caitradarzE tu mAnavaH.
dadyAtpitRRnsamuddizya sa SaNNavatidO bhavEt..53..
-- skandapurANE dvitIyE vaiSNavakhaNDE vaizAkhamAhAtmyE tRtIyE adhyAyE

description.en: Celebrated especially in Kerala/Guruvayur. Commemorates the incident of Kuchela visiting Lord Krishna. Offer naivedyam of `pRthukam`.
Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `lambOdara-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `dvijapriya-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `bhAlacandra-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `vikaTa-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `Ekadanta-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `kRSNapiGgala-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `hEramba-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `vighnarAja-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `vakratuNDa-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `gaNAdhipa-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `Akhuratha-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: Special vrata day for Ganesha. In this month, Ganesha is worshipped as `vibhuvana-mahAgaNapatiH`. Fast during the day and pray to Ganesha after moonrise, as follows:

shlokas:
gaNAdhipastvaM dEvEza caturthyAM pUjitO mayA.
kaSTAn mAM mOcayEzAna sarvamiSTaM ca dEhi mE..

description.en: `saptamI tithi` on a Sunday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Particularly good for worshipping Surya. When `zukla saptamI` is present at sunrise, it is called `vijayA`.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

description.en: `saptamI tithi` on a Sunday is as sacred as a solar eclipse. Particularly good for worshipping Surya. When `zukla saptamI` is present at sunrise, it is called `vijayA`.

shlokas:
amAvasyA tu sOmEna saptamI bhAnunA saha.
caturthI bhUmiputrENa sOmaputrENa cASTamI.
catasrastithayastvEtAH sUryagrahaNasannibhAH..

description.en: When Ashwini nakshatram falls on a Tuesday, it is a special `puNyakAlaH`. Do `upAsanA` of Lakshmi Narasimha.
When `anUrAdhA` nakshatram falls on a Wednesday, it is a special `puNyakAlaH` for performing `dAnam`. One can do `dAnaM` of `dadhyOdanam` in Vishnu temples on this day.
Do puja to Surya/Suryanamaskaram.
Do puja to Surya/Suryanamaskaram.
Do puja to Shiva/Parvati, perform fast.

notes: Pravachanam of Brahmmasri Ky. Bharaneedhara Sastrigal, https://youtu.be/JYNM0zzULPc?t=4289

description.en: Do `upavAsam` (at least do not take salt) and pray to Lord Shiva (Vaidyanatha Swami).
Perform special puja and naivedyam (e.g. `tilAnnam`) to Lord Venkateshwara.
When a lunar eclipse occurs on a Monday, it is even more special: `cUDAmaNi`, i.e. crest jewel.
When a solar eclipse occurs on a Sunday, it is even more special: `cUDAmaNi`, i.e. crest jewel.
A rare combination of `AyuSmAn yOga, bava karaNa` and `saumyavAsara`. Also a source of the normal blessing 'AyuSmAn bava saumya'!
Dvadashi tithi, combined with Punarvasu nakshatram.
Dvadashi tithi, combined with Pushya nakshatram.
Saptami tithi, combined with a sankranti.
Saptami tithi, combined with the first `pAda` of `hasta` nakshatram.
A rare combination of Pausha masam, Shravana nakshatram, Vyatipata yogam and Monday.
A rare combination of Pausha masam, Shravana nakshatram, Vyatipata yogam and Sunday.
Dvadashi tithi, combined with Rohini nakshatram.
Phalguna Krishna Chaturdashi, combined with Shatabhishak Nakshatram.
Phalguna Krishna Chaturdashi, combined with Shatabhishak Nakshatram and Saturday.
Phalguna Krishna Chaturdashi, combined with Shatabhishak Nakshatram, Saturday and Shubha Yogam.
Dvadashi tithi, combined with Shravana nakshatram.
Dvadashi tithi, which is followed by an `amAvasyA` or `paurNamAsI` that touches two consecutive days at sunrise.
Dvadashi tithi, which starts after sunrise on a day and ends before sunrise on the next.
Dvadashi tithi, which is present at sunrise on two consecutive days.
Phalguni Dvadashi tithi, combined with Pushya nakshatram.
If, on a Sunday, `amAvasyA` and one of the stars—`zravaNam`, `azvinI`, `zraviSThA`, `ArdrA` or `AzrESA`—occurs, then it is called `vyatIpAta yOGaH`, equal to a hundred _Surya grahanas_ in merit.

shlokas:
zravaNAzvidhaniSThArdrAnAgadaivatamApatEt.
ravivArayutAmAyAM vyatIpAtaH sa ucyatE.
vyatIpAtAkhyayOgO'yaM zatArkagrahasannibhaH..
references_secondary: Smrti Mukthaphalam Shraddha Kandam Uttara Bhaga

description.en: If, `amAvasyA` occurs on a Monday, Tuesday or Thursday, the combination gives the tithi the name `puSkalA` and is equal to a solar eclipse.

shlokas:
amA sOmEna bhaumEna guruNA vA yutA yadi.
sA tithiH puSkalA nAma sUryagrahaNasannibhA..
references_secondary: Smrti Mukthaphalam Shraddha Kandam Uttara Bhaga

description.en: Tamil New Year.

Coming from Brahma's Kamandalu, Pushkara Raja resides in different rivers, along with 3.5 crore tirthas, following the Sankranti of Guru, for twelve days at the beginning of the Sankranti (`Adi puSkaram`) and at the end of the year (preceding transition to the next `rAzI`, `antya puSkaram`), and for two muhurtas during mid-day, every day, during the entire year.
 Following the transition of Guru to `mESa rAzI`, `puSkararAja` resides in `gaGgA` river.

shlokas:
yadA rAzi-pravEzaH syAttadA prabhRti sarvadA.
dvAdazAhamitE kAlE vastavyaM tu mamA''jJayA..
AvatsaraM tu vastavyaM madhyAhnE dvimuhUrtakam.
antE dvAdaza vastavyaM dinAni ca yathAsukham..

description.en:
Coming from Brahma's Kamandalu, Pushkara Raja resides in different rivers, along with 3.5 crore tirthas, following the Sankranti of Guru, for twelve days at the beginning of the Sankranti (`Adi puSkaram`) and at the end of the year (preceding transition to the next `rAzI`, `antya puSkaram`), and for two muhurtas during mid-day, every day, during the entire year.
 Following the transition of Guru to `mESa rAzI`, `puSkararAja` resides in `gaGgA` river.

dvAdazAhamitE kAlE vastavyaM tu mamA''jJayA..
AvatsaraM tu vastavyaM madhyAhnE dvimuhUrtakam.
antE dvAdaza vastavyaM dinAni ca yathAsukham..

dvAdazAhamitE kAlE vastavyaM tu mamA''jJayA..
AvatsaraM tu vastavyaM madhyAhnE dvimuhUrtakam.
antE dvAdaza vastavyaM dinAni ca yathAsukham..

description.en:
Coming from Brahma's Kamandalu, Pushkara Raja resides in different rivers, along with 3.5 crore tirthas, following the Sankranti of Guru, for twelve days at the beginning of the Sankranti (`Adi puSkaram`) and at the end of the year (preceding transition to the next `rAzI`, `antya puSkaram`), and for two muhurtas during mid-day, every day, during the entire year.
 Following the transition of Guru to `mithuna rAzI`, `puSkararAja` resides in `sarasvatI` river.

shlokas:
yadA rAzi-pravEzaH syAttadA prabhRti sarvadA.
dvAdazAhamitE kAlE vastavyaM tu mamA''jJayA..
AvatsaraM tu vastavyaM madhyAhnE dvimuhUrtakam.
antE dvAdaza vastavyaM dinAni ca yathAsukham..

Coming from Brahma's Kamandalu, Pushkara Raja resides in different rivers, along with 3.5 crore tirthas, following the Sankranti of Guru, for twelve days at the beginning of the Sankranti (`Adi puSkaram`) and at the end of the year (preceding transition to the next `rAzI`, `antya puSkaram`), and for two muhurtas during mid-day, every day, during the entire year.
 Following the transition of Guru to `kumbha rAzI`, `puSkararAja` resides in `bhImarathI` river.

shlokas:
yadA rAzi-pravEzaH syAttadA prabhRti sarvadA.
dvAdazAhamitE kAlE vastavyaM tu mamA''jJayA..
AvatsaraM tu vastavyaM madhyAhnE dvimuhUrtakam.
antE dvAdaza vastavyaM dinAni ca yathAsukham..
